verses.verse: And the LORD<WH3068> spake<WH1696> unto Moses<WH4872>, saying<WH559>,
Speak<WH1696> unto all the congregation<WH5712> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, and say<WH559> unto them, Ye shall be holy<WH6918>: for I the LORD<WH3068> your God<WH430> am holy<WH6918>.
¶ Ye shall fear<WH3372> every man<WH376> his mother<WH517>, and his father<WH1>, and keep<WH8104> my sabbaths<WH7676>: I am the LORD<WH3068> your God<WH430>.
¶ Turn<WH6437> ye not unto idols<WH457>, nor make<WH6213> to yourselves molten<WH4541> gods<WH430>: I am the LORD<WH3068> your God<WH430>.
¶ And if ye offer<WH2076> a sacrifice<WH2077> of peace offerings<WH8002> unto the LORD<WH3068>, ye shall offer<WH2076> it at your own will<WH7522>.

It shall be eaten<WH398> the same day<WH3117> ye offer<WH2077> it, and on the morrow<WH4283>: and if ought remain<WH3498> until the third<WH7992> day<WH3117>, it shall be burnt<WH8313> in the fire<WH784>.
And if it be eaten<WH398> at all<WH398> on the third<WH7992> day<WH3117>, it is abominable<WH6292>; it shall not be accepted<WH7521>.

Therefore every one that eateth<WH398> it shall bear<WH5375> his iniquity<WH5771>, because he hath profaned<WH2490> the hallowed thing<WH6944> of the LORD<WH3068>: and that soul<WH5315> shall be cut off<WH3772> from among his people<WH5971>.

¶ And when ye reap<WH7114> the harvest<WH7105> of your land<WH776>, thou shalt not wholly reap<WH3615> the corners<WH6285> of thy field<WH7704>, neither shalt thou gather<WH3950> the gleanings<WH3951> of thy harvest<WH7105>.

And thou shalt not glean<WH5953> thy vineyard<WH3754>, neither shalt thou gather<WH3950> every grape<WH6528> of thy vineyard<WH3754>; thou shalt leave<WH5800> them for the poor<WH6041> and stranger<WH1616>: I am the LORD<WH3068> your God<WH430>.
¶ Ye shall not steal<WH1589>, neither deal falsely<WH3584>, neither lie<WH8266> one<WH376> to another<WH5997>.
¶ And ye shall not swear<WH7650> by my name<WH8034> falsely<WH8267>, neither shalt thou profane<WH2490> the name<WH8034> of thy God<WH430>: I am the LORD<WH3068>.
¶ Thou shalt not defraud<WH6231> thy neighbour<WH7453>, neither rob<WH1497> him: the wages<WH6468> of him that is hired<WH7916> shall not abide<WH3885> with thee all night until the morning<WH1242>.
¶ Thou shalt not curse<WH7043> the deaf<WH2795>, nor put<WH5414> a stumblingblock<WH4383> before<WH6440> the blind<WH5787>, but shalt fear<WH3372> thy God<WH430>: I am the LORD<WH3068>.

¶ Ye shall do<WH6213> no unrighteousness<WH5766> in judgment<WH4941>: thou shalt not respect<WH5375> the person<WH6440> of the poor<WH1800>, nor honour<WH1921> the person<WH6440> of the mighty<WH1419>: but in righteousness<WH6664> shalt thou judge<WH8199> thy neighbour<WH5997>.
¶ Thou shalt not go<WH3212> up and down as a talebearer<WH7400> among thy people<WH5971>: neither shalt thou stand<WH5975> against the blood<WH1818> of thy neighbour<WH7453>: I am the LORD<WH3068>.
¶ Thou shalt not hate<WH8130> thy brother<WH251> in thine heart<WH3824>: thou shalt in any wise<WH3198> rebuke<WH3198> thy neighbour<WH5997>, and not suffer<WH5375> sin<WH2399> upon him.

¶ Thou shalt not avenge<WH5358>, nor bear any grudge<WH5201> against the children<WH1121> of thy people<WH5971>, but thou shalt love<WH157> thy neighbour<WH7453> as thyself<WH3644>: I am the LORD<WH3068>.

¶ Ye shall keep<WH8104> my statutes<WH2708>. Thou shalt not let thy cattle<WH929> gender<WH7250> with a diverse kind<WH3610>: thou shalt not sow<WH2232> thy field<WH7704> with mingled seed<WH3610>: neither shall a garment<WH899> mingled<WH3610> of linen and woollen<WH8162> come<WH5927> upon thee.

¶ And whosoever<WH376> lieth<WH7901> carnally<WH2233><WH7902> with a woman<WH802>, that is a bondmaid<WH8198>, betrothed<WH2778> to an husband<WH376>, and not at all<WH6299> redeemed<WH6299>, nor freedom<WH2668> given<WH5414> her; she shall be scourged<WH1244>; they shall not be put to death<WH4191>, because she was not free<WH2666>.

And he shall bring<WH935> his trespass offering<WH817> unto the LORD<WH3068>, unto the door<WH6607> of the tabernacle<WH168> of the congregation<WH4150>, even a ram<WH352> for a trespass offering<WH817>.

And the priest<WH3548> shall make an atonement<WH3722> for him with the ram<WH352> of the trespass offering<WH817> before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068> for his sin<WH2403> which he hath done<WH2398>: and the sin<WH2403> which he hath done<WH2398> shall be forgiven<WH5545> him.

¶ And when ye shall come<WH935> into the land<WH776>, and shall have planted<WH5193> all manner of trees<WH6086> for food<WH3978>, then ye shall count<WH6188> the fruit<WH6529> thereof as uncircumcised<WH6188><WH6190>: three<WH7969> years<WH8141> shall it be as uncircumcised<WH6189> unto you: it shall not be eaten<WH398> of.
But in the fourth<WH7243> year<WH8141> all the fruit<WH6529> thereof shall be holy<WH6944> to praise<WH1974> the LORD<WH3068> withal.
And in the fifth<WH2549> year<WH8141> shall ye eat<WH398> of the fruit<WH6529> thereof, that it may yield<WH3254> unto you the increase<WH8393> thereof: I am the LORD<WH3068> your God<WH430>.
¶ Ye shall not eat<WH398> any thing with the blood<WH1818>: neither shall ye use enchantment<WH5172>, nor observe times<WH6049>.
Ye shall not round<WH5362> the corners<WH6285> of your heads<WH7218>, neither shalt thou mar<WH7843> the corners<WH6285> of thy beard<WH2206>.
Ye shall not make<WH5414> any<WH3793> cuttings<WH8296> in your flesh<WH1320> for the dead<WH5315>, nor print<WH5414> any marks<WH7085> upon you: I am the LORD<WH3068>.
¶ Do not prostitute<WH2490> thy daughter<WH1323>, to cause her to be a whore<WH2181>; lest the land<WH776> fall to whoredom<WH2181>, and the land<WH776> become full<WH4390> of wickedness<WH2154>.
¶ Ye shall keep<WH8104> my sabbaths<WH7676>, and reverence<WH3372> my sanctuary<WH4720>: I am the LORD<WH3068>.
¶ Regard<WH6437> not them that have familiar spirits<WH178>, neither seek<WH1245> after wizards<WH3049>, to be defiled<WH2930> by them: I am the LORD<WH3068> your God<WH430>.
¶ Thou shalt rise up<WH6965> before<WH6440> the hoary head<WH7872>, and honour<WH1921> the face<WH6440> of the old man<WH2205>, and fear<WH3372> thy God<WH430>: I am the LORD<WH3068>.
¶ And if a stranger<WH1616> sojourn<WH1481> with thee in your land<WH776>, ye shall not vex<WH3238> him.

But the stranger<WH1616> that dwelleth<WH1481> with you shall be unto you as one born<WH249> among you, and thou shalt love<WH157> him as thyself; for ye were strangers<WH1616> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>: I am the LORD<WH3068> your God<WH430>.
¶ Ye shall do<WH6213> no unrighteousness<WH5766> in judgment<WH4941>, in meteyard<WH4060>, in weight<WH4948>, or in measure<WH4884>.

Just<WH6664> balances<WH3976>, just<WH6664> weights<WH68>, a just<WH6664> ephah<WH374>, and a just<WH6664> hin<WH1969>, shall ye have: I am the LORD<WH3068> your God<WH430>, which brought you out<WH3318> of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>.
Therefore shall ye observe<WH8104> all my statutes<WH2708>, and all my judgments<WH4941>, and do<WH6213> them: I am the LORD<WH3068>.
